instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance â€“ this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Hi
Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-2 has no display with battery. i have checked with different battery also but got same response. i am getting display on external and internal both without battery.
there is no liquid split sign on board or damaged component. Also checked with two different good screens.
USB meter shows 1-2 Amp when plug in with battery. it seems, it try to turn on but soon goes to 0 Amp and start taking heavy current(1.5 Amp approx.) looks like charging battery. Tried PRAM reset.
Also not able to login the device. it get stuck at login screen after entering the password and stays at login screen for hours. after that start rebooting at apple logo ion every 5 sec.
What could be the problem? i have no idea where to start.

Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Try DFU revive.
If no important data on SSD, then try restore option instead.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Hi

I have tried Revive and Restore both in DFU, After finish line each time i got the second image. System not booting at all. nothing on screen.
But when i unplug the battery and booted with charger only , ?mark was there on screen.


[ATTACH]59851[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59852[/ATTACH][ATTACH]59853[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Something similar happened to me with a machine damaged because of liquid spill on the audio board.
In my case, I couldn't even complete DFU.
But didn't note the battery issue.

Inspect audio flex and board for liquid signs (both sides).

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message: I have checked each and every single component on board, there is no liquid damage, rusted or loose soldering component. device shows display without battery and also acting with Command+R going for recovery.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Check exact resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode, with both charger and battery connected.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> levels.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Tried SMC bypass mode nothing happened. 
Diode mode values on <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>- .455V on both ends and <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR>- .0545V.
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>-0V.
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>- 0V.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
I was expecting ohm resistance between caps pins, not diode mode to ground.
Probably good, if still not working in SMC bypass mode.

Do you get external video with battery connected?
Check at least for USB activity then.
CPU voltages present?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
First of all, Thanks Vali for your help and guidance.
there is no external video or USB activity with battery connected. 

These are the CPU voltages which i check with battery connected and without battery, didn't found major difference.
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>--0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>-- 1.132V (without battery <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>-- 0.712V)
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>--0.751V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>--0.964V

<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL>--1.2V
<SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVT</SIGNAL>-- 0.6V present

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
1.132V at CPU core means board is stuck, doesn't really boot.
iGPU is normal 0V, until high load graphics is detected.

"Diode mode values on <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>- .455V on both ends and <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR>- .0545V."
I was asking for OHM resistance between their pins, not diode mode to ground.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> and C702 both has 2.6 Ohm between both ends.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message: Is the battery charging at least?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Yes, Battery is charging well.
It is taking normal current to charge the battery approx 1.2 Amp to 2 Amp depends

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Connect both charger and battery,
Then monitor <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; it should slowly increase, if battery is really charging.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message: initially <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was 12.72 and then suddenly jumped to 12.93V. tried 2-3 time but jumping directly from 12.68V to 12.93V and further no increase in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Strange behaviour.
Find known good battery for test; not new chinese crap.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>    No display on external and internal with battery
threads.message:
Hi
I checked with different battery. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is increasing gradually from 12.10V upto 12.65V slowly.
